newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Astro to spend A$5 mln on diamonds.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Astro to spend A$5 mln on diamonds.

text.p: Mining entrepreneur Joe Gutnick's Astro Mining NL said on Tuesday it expected to spend A$5 million on diamond exploration and research in the Yilgarn region of Western Australia over the next three years.

About A$3 million will be allocated for exploration and a further A$2 million for research of Astro's six prospects, which cover some 32,500 square km north-east of Kalgoorlie, Stephan Meyer, general manager of exploration for Astro said.
"Results from the research could be seen in exploration as early as the middle of next year," Meyer said
Meyer was speaking to Reuters after addressing the Paydirt diamond conference here.
The research will study geochemical difficulties associated with the region's harsh environment, Meyer said.
"Three years is an extremely long time in market terms," Meyer said. "But we expect the results during the research's course, rather than at its end."
Meye told Reuters that Australia was largely been unexplored for diamonds and that research is critical to finding new diamond fields.
Gutnick is chairman and managing director of Astro.
